result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: with credit for 0 days time served.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, also to include those ordered in count 2,  and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
- Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
- Restitution is set at 0.

No contact with firearms.
48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harassment".
NO NEW LAW VIOALTIONS.

Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention.
Parenting classes.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

01-08-16/ Judge Jeffrey A Wagner
Defendant is non-compliant with Probation conditions.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend 45 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time, in the HOC.

STAYED pending a review on 1-8-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.

supervisions.notes: All costs, assessments and surcharges to be paid during probation in count 1 or a civil judgment to be entered.
With credit for 59 days time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert A Anderson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reflects 01-08-16 Court order imposing 45 days of condition time

Attorney Brian Burke in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per email from Probation Dept., defendant is currently in absconder status.  Court ordered defendant to serve 45 days of the condition time; straight time.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant Robert A Anderson in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Robert A Anderson in custody.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.  Additional statement by Brianna W.
AS to count 1:   The court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, with credit for 0 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 45 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 1-8-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Parenting classes.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harassment".
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, also to include those ordered in count 2,  and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.  All 
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-Restitution is set at 0.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.
AS to count 2:  The court sentences the defendant to serve 60 days House of Correction with credit for 59 days time served.  All costs, assessments and surcharges to be paid during probation in count 1 or a civil judgment to be entered.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Robert A Anderson in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Robert A Anderson in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant will enter pleas of GUILTY to counts 1 and 2, with the REPEATER enhancer being deleted as to count 1.  Count 3 is ordered dismissed and read in for sentencing.
AS to counts 1 and 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Sentencing was to begin, however, defense counsel believes there may be a breach of the plea agreement.  Court will adjourn for 2 weeks to allow counsel to file a motion for withdrawal of plea.  Defendant is remanded.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense motion to modify bail is argued and granted.  The court will modify to $200.00 cash bail TOT Justicepoint with GPS monitoring.  Upon verification by JP the court will allow release for education/vocational services.  
Case is adjourned to 9-16-2015 for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Robert A Anderson in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests an adjourned Bail/Bond Hearing. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 38.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BW dob 12/28/93 or MM-P dob 5/3/96

Defendant Robert A Anderson in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Robert A Anderson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
